metadata.title: CVE-2022-48816 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:SUNRPC: lock against ->sock changing during sysfs read->sock can be set to NULL asynchronously unless ->recv_mutex is held.So it is important to hold that mutex.  Otherwise a sysfs read cantrigger an oops.Commit 17f09d3f619a ("SUNRPC: Check if the xprt is connected beforehandling sysfs reads") appears to attempt to fix this problem, but itonly narrows the race window.
